org.criteria4jpa.criterion
Interface Criterion

All Known Implementing Classes:
BetweenExpression, Conjunction, Disjunction, IsEmptyExpression, IsNullExpression, Junction, SimpleExpression
public interface Criterion

Interface describing a restriction that can be added to a Criteria.

The Criterion is rendered to a WHERE expression in the generated JPQL query and may be added to a Criteria by calling Criteria.add(Criterion).

You should use the static factory methods of Restrictions to obtain predefined restrictions.

Author:
Christian Kaltepoth

Method Summary
 Object[] getParameterValues()
          Returns the query parameter values of this Criterion.
 String toQueryString(Criteria criteria, CriteriaQueryBuilder queryBuilder)
          Renders the Criterion to a WHERE expression in the JPQL query.
 

Method Detail

toQueryString

String toQueryString(Criteria criteria,
                     CriteriaQueryBuilder queryBuilder)
Renders the Criterion to a WHERE expression in the JPQL query.

Parameters:
criteria - The criteria this criterion was added to
queryBuilder - The query builder that is currently building the query
Returns:
The JPQL WHERE expression

getParameterValues

Object[] getParameterValues()
Returns the query parameter values of this Criterion. The order of the values in the array must match the order of the ? place holders in the expression created by toQueryString(Criteria, CriteriaQueryBuilder).

Returns:
Array of query parameters
